posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
While I'm buggering about with the skill points, do please have a look a Torlin's daily training schedule (we'll deal with his "issues" another time).
SpoilerYou could barely have called it dawn. That funereal grey light before the sun crawls up that has no colour in it. Few faces abroad, and those that were made ghosts. The empty country turned into the land of the dead. Torlin's favourite time of the day. He pounded through the camp of Debruca's division, a sprawling maze of canvas all in blissful, sleeping silence. Mist clung to the flattened grass, wreathed the closest tents, turned distant ones to phantoms. His servants were waiting for him in the clearing outside his tent. Unrinc brought him a bucket and he drank deep, cold water running down his burning throat. Younger brought the case, straining under the weight, and Torlin slid his practice blades from inside. Great, blunt lengths of battered metal, their pommels big as half-bricks to lend some semblance of balance. Three times the weight of his battle steels, which were already of a particularly heavy design. In wonderful silence they came for him, Unrinc with shield and stick, Younger jabbing away with the pole, Torlin struggling to parry with his unwieldy iron. They gave him no time and no chances, no mercy and no respect. He wanted none. He had been given chances before Filstrava, and allowed himself to grow soft. To grow blunt. When the moment came, he was found wanting. Never again. If another moment came, it would find him forged from steel, sharpened to a merciless, murderous razor's edge. And so, every morning for the last four years, every morning since Filstrava, every morning without fail, in sun or rain or snow - this. The clonk and scrape of wood on metal. The occasional thud and grunt as sticks bounced off armour or found their marks between. The rhythm of his ripping breath, his pounding heart, his savage effort. The sweat soaking his jacket, tickling his scalp, flying drops from his visor. The burning in every muscle, worse and worse, better and better, as if he could burn away his disgrace and live again. He stood there, mouth gaping, eyes closed, while they unbuckled his armour. When they lifted the breastplate off it felt as if he was floating away. Off into the sky, never to come down.




Cheers

Time for another snipped of the man - this time doing what he does best...
Spoiler... He felt soldiers pushing forward, their blood rising, surging across the bridge with an irresistible momentum, carrying him northwards. He cut someone down with his long steel, laid someone else's head open with the corner of his shield, strap twisting in his hand, his face aching he was smiling so hard, every breath burning with joy.


And, worst of all, he cares whether he loses. Their blades met in the air with a deafening crash, but Torlin's timing was perfect and it was the Northman who staggered off balance, favouring perhaps a weak left knee. Torlin was on him in a flash, but someone else's stray weapon struck him on the shoulder-plate before he could swing, sent him stumbling into the man in black's arms. They lumbered in an awkward embrace. The Northman tried to beat at him with the haft of his mace, trip him, shake him off. Torlin held tight. He was vaguely aware of fighting around them, of men locked in their own desperate struggles, but he was lost in the moment, eyes closed.








Is this still battle? Is this still the glorious matching of man against man? Or is this just murder? He looked back towards his own lines. The trail of broken bodies no longer felt like anything to take pride in. He stood, skin prickling with sweat, sucking air through gritted teeth and frowning through the crops to the north.
I should be ashamed of myself.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Ok.

Level 27, build performs well, but as I feared, things are slowing down somewhat.  I have had to go to great lengths to get the build outfitted (in my preferred environment, WoG - YMMV) appropriately, to face the many facetted opponents and their abilities, skills (yes, WoG opponents make great use of certain skills ala Taunt, etc), and magicks.

So, with what immunites and abilities that I could bolster, I have.  Still working on getting enough SR to toss caution in the wind atm.  Still, the build is performing well.  Not absolutely great, as one would have thought it would, but well enough.  Probably because Dev Crit has been nerfed HARD on WoG (and the expected downturn of Fort saves has not followed) - it is just inevitable that the opponent will roll a 1 (and with a crit range of 10~20, this build threatens crits ALL.THE.TIME!). I will say that my by now infamously known bad luck with dice rolls means that instead of an expected 1~2 crits a round (dependingly), I normally see around...1 every 10? attacks?  That seems about right.

I think something is weird in the Tony K AI.  If I test this build, for example, with the normal AI (I use the PGCC with CEP) to do this, and I do not experience oneses like I do on WoG.  In fact, the rando vanilla generator seems to be rather unbiased, as far as it can be and I can tell.

Not the same with WoG.

Examples I have really noticed are when extremes are present (meaning, one can only miss the opponent on a 1, regardless of the -5 AB chain in one round) and I am using things like IKD and ID (improved knockdown and improved disarm).  Even when factoring in the -4 AB malus to the attempts, I still need a 1 roll to miss.  That is the test foundation.

Facit : Vanilla Bioware AI lets me basically do this and succeed as one would expect, with only occassionally a 1 roll for failure.  Everything is normal, and WaD (working as designed).

WoG with Tony K's AI - 1 roll on first attack 80% of the time! O_o  Failed followups 50% (meaning yes, more 1s in the SAME round!!).  This will continue for, oh, 2~3 rounds, then sharply drop off to equal normal vanilla AI rolls (whereby the opponent in the same timeframe will often roll nat 20s, multiple times when ýou are missing, then it drops off as with the 1 rolls).

I suspect Tony did this on purpose to make each combat "exciting" - but that is just my opinion.

Ok, enough of a rant here, back to the build - I am really pleasantly surprised by the saves.  They are extraordinarily good!  True, they are boosted by gear (something one can do in my play environment), but still...very nice (not that it is really helpful for me, as I am often plagued by 1 rolls).

I am looking forwards to how the build continues to perform as levels rise towards and into the 30s.

Hit the low 30s now...

Build performs admirably, but alas, my luck(unluck) with 1s plagues it.  Lacking UMD or any way to use spells, it is very, very susceptible to any sort of weapon borne OnHit type property, as I have found out.  Even if it is a "fail on a 1" situation, get hit enough times, and yeah.  Although in my case, it's always the very first one *sigh* 🤔

Died twice to such occurances, meaning I had a loooooong trek back, only to die again to the SAME thing, same situation (first save, roll 1, bam, dead).  Nasty 😱

Third time was the charm 😏

On the strategy of IKD->ID, that has slown way, way down now...most things just shrug off a KD attempt (not immune just boostered Cons and Str through the roof, along with maxed out Disc means very little chance even with a high AB), and that, of course, means that ID chances are less (less KDs, less ID attempts).

AB is still good, hits come often (when the WoG AI is being "nice", which is not often meh).  I'm starting to get quite frustrated with the generation of crits, however - most opponents I face just do not have an AC that can withstand this builds AB (understandable, it's WM heavy and full BAB).  With a keen weapon (scimi), my chance is 10~20, so one can reasonable expect at least 1 crit a round (note that for these opponents, all 4 attacks only miss on a 1).  Nope, far, far from it.  I get about 1 crit every 5 rounds at first...then kind of like a flurry of them, then a long stretch again of nothing.  Irritating.  It means that, due to the lack of serious tumble, the AC is a tick lacking, meaning I get walloped a few times, first.  Nothing a bit of healing and regen cannot take care of (along with some physical and elemental DR).

Dreading the mid 30s, as WoG is now a barren wasteland of opportunites from 35+, due to all the nerf hammers.

Gonna be a slow, mind-numbing slog.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
But then again, players tend to be biased when the roll doesn't go their way.
Yeah, I get that alot, you know, "confirmation bias" and all that rot.

So, I documented my rolls for over the course of an entire year.  The rolls are heavily skewed against me.

In my example, I have 6 months of saves documented, as well.  These are under specific conditions :

Must be the first save, must be against something that will result in death, must be a "fail on a 1" save. 

I then used around 50 different PCs to test this.

I think I got to 30? 1 rolls, spread out between 50 different PCs (meaning, I played until the following condition above, changing after death).  That's 30 consecutive 1s, confirming that something is heavily influencing first saves vs a death situation - https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/worldof ... t6312.html

I think you are correct, of course, most will claim that they were "ganked" by the 1 roll (or low roll) because they have not kept track of all the other rolls.  Again, confirmation bias.

In my case, I became suspicious because I have a number of PCs that can only fail things on a 1 roll, period.  And it was happening ALOT!!

Too much to be a coincidence, or my overexaggerated imagination.  So, indeed (and after getting pinpricked by MrZork to death with "it's just confirmation bias, you haven't blah blah blah), I did the above tests, and proved beyond the shadow of a doubt that yes, WoG AI hates me, and wants me ded.

YMMV

Well, after much effort, I have come to the following conclusion :

This build is a massive failure.

It starts out very strong, continues, and then sharply drops off in the middle 30s, until it is absolutely useless.

This build will excel in a party, where it can rely on buffs and protections from Clerics/Druids/Mages, etc.  It is a front line beast, no doubt about it, basically a high DPS build.  It desperately needs protection vs any type of non-spell like abilities that affect mind/threaten death, etc.

Though, as I mentioned, I was able to partially bulwark immunites onto the build in the environment that I play in, even I reached my limits.

Facit : build is fun to play up to and including low 30s, but then is no longer viable without major aid from being in a party.

A simple Fighter 28/Bard 2/RDD will beat the living shite out of this build, hands down (in every regards).

One of the weakest of things in this build is CoT - I know some like it, and yeah, it gives extra yadda yadda yadda, but 1/day Wrath and 1/day (can be up to 3, if one wants to take it) Smite Evil just does not come close to other Class combinations.  All of my experiences going CoT have been...very, very disappointing.

It just suxx0rs.

IF Wrath was somehow like Rage is for Barbs, that would go a long way towards boosting this PrC imo.  Having more uses of Wrath would make CoT a really nice thing.  Or perhaps having epic feat choices that allow for more of Wrath...I don't care how it is handled, but it needs this, desperately to even begin to contend with other classes.  I suppose it is a good addition to Pally, though I struggle to find a reason why.

YMMV

P.S. I have given up on trying more with this build, as it is just a PitA in my environment in mid 30s to deal with.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I was looking soley from a solo perspective, Stag. Perhaps it is a tick too much to say massive, but...I was really chugging along and then BAM!  The drop off was palpable (multiple deaths and no solution).

I said that it would "excel in a party, where it can rely on buffs and protections from Clerics/Druids/Mages, etc" to my and this build's defence.

In the environment where I play, one does solo play at one's own risk.  It is specifically designed for a classic D&D Party (Warrior, Priest, Mage, Thief), and the skills and abilities that they bring.  If one is going to solo on WoG, one needs to simulate all these skills and abilities to succeed. This does not mean constantly, but procedurally.

This build does do that, to some extent - skills are plenty, abilities for the most part are present (for example I was able to get enough skillpoints to have sufficient OL to get where it needed to go, and to open important chests, as well as get enough Search to find important secret doors, etc).  Most of the utility spell department I was able to offset with consummables and other items that were universally usable.  But mind stuff...well, that leaves only an item that allows Circle of Protection vs Alignment, and Clarity potions.  And these get blown off by dispels and breaches immediately, which makes it difficult (especially in a battle where you are getting pummeled by OnHit : X).  To that, there are creatures that spam Death effect, and unfortunately the immunity item(s) available against this conflict with a very important piece of equipment in that slot that is a must have (it contains both my Improved Evasion and my Freedom of Movement, among other essential things, which is an absolute must have, especially at high levels). And even though the saving throws are ok (Fort is excellent, Will not so much), fail on a 1 trumps all.

Just the luck of the draw, I guess.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Returning to this, after critically examining WHY this build fails to perform in the environment where I play (WoG).

The AC is way too low.

At level 33, I am sitting at 45 AC.  Anything and everything can hit and easily crit me (and they do).  Although the AB of this build is sufficient, I am getting the crud whacked out of me.

For this level, I am missing an incredible 15 AC (more if I want to have a "comfortable" AC buffer i.e. 70+).  One reason is that due to no UMD, I cannot utilize the Helm slot for KD immunity (a must have on WoG - forget about Discipline).  Thus, the only other slot left is the Boots slot, and even with some of the best KD immune boots, that leaves me with a +5 (in this case, +6!!) AC deficit (IF I am in an area where there is no KD, I can equip some +6 boots).  This deficit did not show until recent levels (because a 45 AC at pre 30s is not too bad, but as levels climb, so too the AB of opponents).  As it is now, I am facing opponents that easily hit AC 60 (meaning they only miss me on a 1, and crit me constantly).  Getting critted for 100+ every time (and in a group, that can mean 600+ damage in one ROUND!!! O_o) basically means dead, dead, DEAD.

Without some lucky drop of an item that has KD immunity on it (which, alas, I have not had yet), it is impossible (see above) to adventure in areas where there is abundant enough XP to level.

So, as I said before (I think?), the build starts out well, gets really good, then...like a drop off, sputters, and dies.  I am left with just walzing around with low level m0bs, smacking them around (which is fun, in it's own way), but other than the odd drop or two, nothing spectacular there.  XP per kill is around 1~3, dependingly.

One lucky drop could change things.
